text: Strange, one of our devs still cant get it to work. We’ve opened a ticket with support but this portal is alittle weird in the sense that there are no live pages on their main domain, only on the subdomains.
Hey all, is it possible to include the featured image from pages/posts in the search results? Ideally within the default site search functionality instead of something custom?
Features images for blog posts should be returned

<@U6GNQ7JBU> Is there a link you can send me with resources about how to access those? I know if this documentation but I don't see featured images referenced anywhere. Thank you in advance!!! <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/content/search-for-content>
Sure for an example API response, I use HubSpot <https://www.HubSpot.com/_hcms/search?term=HubSpot&type=BLOG_POST>
You can see for blog posts the `featuredImageUrl` is returned
<@U6GNQ7JBU> is that limited to blog posts? If I set a featured image on a dynamic page, it’d be cool to be able to show that
It pulls from the og:image tag and falls back on the value provided in the page/blog editor
